sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: John Flete OSB, De fundatione ecclesiae Westmonasterii. Chronicon episcoporum Eliensium
Joh. Flete, etc.
msDesc.p: Vellum and paper, 251 170 10 x 7, ff. cir. 140, 31-34 lines to a page. Cent. xvi, in several fairly good hands.

head.title: Breve excerptum ex historia Iohannis Marii Belgici de schismatibus
Breve excerptum ex historia I. Marii Belgi de schismatibus de Helena matre Constantini magni

msItem.rubric: Ex historia J. Marii Belgi de schismatibus p. 416
msItem.ab: (The reason why the Kings of England wear the Imperial crown)

head.title: Letter of Michael Renniger to Matthew Parker, 25 October
Epistola Michaelis Renigeri ad Mattheum Cantuariensem cum prefatione de autoritate argumento et summa libri sequentis

msItem.ab: Letter of Michael Renniger (Reniger) to Parker, dated Lambeth, 25 October. He says of the book: Erat in arca quadam libraria longe a me dissita inter alios domini Hugonis Latimer libros retrusus. (See Robinson, p. 32.) Renniger or Rhanger died in 1609
Preface, of the same date: signed in full. Both these are copied out more clearly on ff. iiir-ivv: the signature here is only M. R.
The above are on a vellum leaf which has been folded into four

msItem.head: John Flete OSB, De fundatione ecclesiae Westmonasterii

head.title: Liber breviter compilatus de fundatione et erectione ecclesiae Westmonasteriensis, prout in chronicis et scriptis authenticis invenitur, autore Iohanne Flete

ab.quote:
Continet historiam monasterii et abbatum qui ibidem praefuerunt a prima fundatione ad annum 1386.
XIXo Juni Anno 1572. Hic liber transcriptus ex veteri quodam libro scripto de fundatione ecclesiae Westmonasteriensis, qui liber jam remanet in custodia D. Goodman decani ejusdem ecclesiae

msItem.rubric: Incipit prohemium libri breuiter compilati, etc.
msItem.ab: On f. 1v is a reference in the text to 'Cronica que liber Regius appellatur': a footnote says: Cronica Regia ideo dicitur quia Rex Richardus secundus eam scribi fecit a monacho quodam cenobii Sancti Edmundi de Burye. See MS 251
msItem.explicit: per tria quarteria anni et duas septimanas et amplius
msItem.ab: The manuscript of Flete's History from which this is copied is still at Westminster in the Library of the Dean and Chapter
See the edition by Dr J. Armitage Robinson, Dean of Westminster (1909)

head.title: Chronicon episcoporum Eliensium ab Harvaeo primo episcopo ad mortem Philippi Morgan episcopi XXIII, anno 1434
Historia episcoporum Eliensium ab Harvaeo primo episcopo ad mortem Philippi Morgan episcopi XXIII, anno 1434

msItem.incipit: Post mortem Richardi abbatis mittitur a rege henrico
msItem.explicit: Sedit annis ix Sept. xxvj dies quatuor

head.title: Catalogus episcoporum Eliensium ab Harvaeo ad Ricardum Cox

msItem.ab: A list of Bishops with duration of their pontificates from Herveus to Richard Coxe

msItem.head: Nigel Witeker OSB, Contra curiales et officiales clericos siue De eruditione praelatorum (prose version)

head.title: Epistola Nigelli [Wireker] monachi Cantuariensis ad Gulielmum de Longocampo episcopum Eliensem de abusu rerum ecclesiasticarum

msItem.incipit: Reuerendo patri et domino Willelmum, etc. frater Nigellus
msItem.ab:
Versificator quidam Cantuariensis qui scripsit carmine Archiepiscopos Cantuarienses sic desinit in Richardo.
Richardus. Inde gradu functus est pre consortibus unctus Presul Richardus vir mitis et ad mala tardus etc. Sic miserando tamen ut quod dedit auferat. Amen.
Hic uir timuit ne Nigellus Wireker monachus succederet ad Archiepiscopatum Cant. post Richardum. Baleus de eo scribit, p. 245
See Wright's Satirical Poets of the twelfth century, Rolls Series I 153

recordHist.p: remarks: Silently omitted remark about foliation turning to pagination.
